intro: Parabaena oleracea, commonly known as the common parabaena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Parabaena oleracea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
